content.description:
Uncle Remus 5.8 * (90') F(8b)

On the left side of the lower face, begin just left of the big arching corner and climb up and eventually angling right to share the 2 chain top anchors with "Uncle Meat". Crux is passing the 2nd bolt.

Variation -

Electric Aunt Jemima 5.8 * (80') F(5b)

After the second bolt head up and left to the pair of chain anchors at the lip below the huge Serviceberry clump. A bit better than Uncle Remus....
content.location: At the left side of the lower face, begin just left of the big arching corner and climb up and right to the chain anchors.

content.description:
Uncle Meat 5.9 *** (85') F(9b)

On the left side of the face, being about 15' right of the large broken arching corner and climb directly up through the small roof at mid face. This is a really fun route on unexpectedly good rock, with great incut holds and sustained interesting moves right to the very top. Shares top chain anchors with Uncle Remus.
content.location: On the left side of the face, being about 15' right of the large broken arching corner and climb directly up through the small roof at mid face.

content.description:
THE TORTURE NEVER STOPS - 5.9 ** (55') F(5b)

Climbs directly up the reddish polished left side of the FZ Wall to the 2 chain anchors on the lip. A short, but sustained, interesting and challenging climb throughout - if you take the direct line.
content.location: At the far left end of the FZ Wall (before the arching overhanging section)

content.description:
Stink-Foot 5.9- *** (70') F(7b)

Begin at the left edge of the main central corner, climb the arête (stepping around to the right side for a few moves then back to the left and on), through the small roof at mid level to the 2 chain anchors on top. Lots of fun.
content.location: Begin at the base of the arete in the middle of the main central corner. Chain anchors on top.

content.description:
Plastic People 5.7 *** (75') F(6b)

Begin as for Help I'm a Rock (directly below the huge boulder on top), but step right and climb directly up, turning the overhang on the left side (crux), and on to the pair of cold-shuts at the top, just right of the huge perched boulder. Fun, varied and sustained.
content.protection: Fixed - 6 bolts, cold shuts on top.
content.location: At the far right end of the FZ Wall (before reaching the large overhanging area)

content.description:
None of the Above - 5.7 ** (60') F (6b)

Begin 20' left of "Any Way the Wind Blows" (just right of the large mock-orange bush) and climb directly up to the 2 bolt with quick-links anchors that are on the wall about 10' below the top. Consistent and fun climbing until the last 10' of 2nd class below the anchors.
content.location: At the right end of the crag begin 20' left of "Any Way the Wind Blows" (just right of the large mock-orange bush).

content.description:
IT CAN’T HAPPEN HERE  5.11b **** (65’) F (7b)

Climbs the short but sweet middle of the overhanging section on the far left end of FZ Wall to easier but still interesting face to the chain anchors on the huge boulder at the top.
content.location: At the far left end of the FZ Wall - climb the obvious line through the overhang directly below the huge boulder on top.

content.description:
Imaginary Diseases - 5.10b *** (75') F(8b)

On the left side of the face this takes a direct line beginning about 20' left of the big corner (from the top of a pile of rocks at the base). Stay left of the small roof at mid face. Consistently interesting and tricky moves with cruxes in the lower, mid and top sections, which may seem harder for a shorter climber. Chains are on the top lip.
content.location: Begin 20' left of the main central corner

content.description:
Hot Rats 5.8 *** (75') F(7b)

Begin about 35' right of the main corner and climb directly up sustained and interesting moves to the chains at the lip. The crux between the 1st and 2nd bolt may be a bit harder for a shorter climber - the rest of the route is easier (5.5 to 6-ish) with an abundance of holds on excellent rock.
content.location: On the right side of lower wall.

content.description:
Help I'm a Rock 5.9 ** (80') F(7b)

Begin about 50' right of the big corner at the right side of the lower loose looking blocks at the base directly below the huge boulder perched on the top lip, and climb the line up and left to end at the chains left of the top boulder.
content.location: 50' right of the big corner, climb left of the large boulder on top to the chain anchors at the lip.

content.description:
Dog Breath Variations - 5.6 * (80') M(4b)

Begin 20' right of the big corner. Climb directly up through a couple of interesting mantles to the directional bolt at the top. Traverse right to share the top chains with Hot Rats. A few small to medium cams are needed in the middle section.
content.protection: Mixed, 4 bolts and several small to medium cams.
content.location: Begin 20' right of the big corner.

content.description:
Filthy Habits - 5.6 * (95') G

Climbs the main corner, using the crack and the face on the right. The crux is getting past (through!) the bush up high. Above that avoid Chunga's Revenge and step left into the exit ramp above the corner and then continue up the slab left and then back right to the rap anchors atop Chunga's Revenge. Needs a wide range of cams and/or nuts to protect.
content.protection: Gear - a wide range of cams from 00 to #2 or 3, can also be protected with just nuts and stoppers.
content.location: The main inside corner in the middle of the lower face.

content.description:
Father O'Blivion 5.9 *** (80') F(9b)

On the left side of the wall, begin about 10' right of "Uncle Meat" and climb up to the 2 chain anchors over the top. This is a fine sustained well protected route (mostly 5.7-8) that has a thin crux near the top.
content.location: On the left side of the face, begin about 10' right of Uncle Meat.

content.description:
EAT THAT QUESTION 5.8 ** (60') F/M( 6b)

Begin about 10' left of Chrome Plated Megaphone and climb directly up to the 2 chain anchors. Consistently interesting climbing with cruxes down low and up high.
content.protection: Fixed - 6 bolts (may want a .75 cam for between the last 2 bolts).
content.location: 2nd route from the far left of the Lower FZ Wall

content.description:
Chunga's Revenge 5.4 ** (95') F (6b)

Begin about 10' right of the main corner. Climb directly up to the 2 chain anchors above the top ledge. Long way to 1st bolt and may seem a bit run-out and hard for the grade throughout, especially for a short climber. This is also the rap route for the face - beware of potentially loose rock and dirt on the slope below the rap anchors.
content.location:
First route (from the left) on the right side of the face, begin about 10' right of the main corner.

This is also the rap route for the crag.

climbs.name: The Chrome Plated Megaphone of Destiny

content.description:
THE CHROME PLATED MEGAPHONE OF DESTINY

- 5.6 ** (65') F(5b)

Begin at the short vertical crack about 10' left of the start of Uncle Remus, climb the face to the arête on top and the final traverse left to share the 2 chain anchors with Eat That Question. The crux is getting to the 3rd bolt, and may seem hard for the grade for a short climber.
content.location: 3rd route from the left end of FZ Wall

content.description:
Any Way the Wind Blows - 5.5** (66') F(7b)

Climbs the far right end of FZ Wall, beginning about 5' right of the large serviceberry. A cruxish start leads to fun mostly consistent climbing on good rock (with an easier 3rd class 10' section 3/4s of the way up), to the two bolt anchor with quick-links on the wall above the bushy ledge (as well, there's a directional bolt at the top lip for top-roping).
content.location: The furthest right route on FZ Wall.

content.description:
ELECTRIC AUNT JEMIMA - 5.8 * (80') F/M(5b)

A good variation of Uncle Remus. After the 2nd bolt (crux) head up and left to the pair of chain anchors on the lip below the huge Serviceberry clump. May want to take some small to medium nuts for below the last bolt.
content.protection: Fixed - 5 bolts, but a small to medium nut before the last nut may be desired...
content.location: Begin as for Uncle Remus (just left of the large arching corner), ends at the chains below the Serviceberry on top.
